body.name: Monoprice Ultra 8K High Speed HDMI Cable - 48Gbps, 8K@60Hz, Dynamic HDR, eARC, 1 Feet, Black - Ultra Slim Series
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Sunday, February 18 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 14 hrs 13 mins
features: The 8K@60Hz resolution delivers a more immersive viewing experience, with sharper high speed content, while the 4k@120hz resolution produces Ultra fast And sharp images, which are great for sports, high performance Gaming, and VR.

Dynamic HDR ensures that every moment of a video is displayed with its ideal depth, detail, brightness, contrast, and a wider color gamut, optimized on a scene-by-scene or even a frame-by-frame basis.

These cables deliver 48Gbps bandwidth, which helps prevent handshake issues, snow, video noise, and other anomalies. They fully support high bandwidth dependent video and Audio features, such as dynamic HDR, Dolby vision, Dolby Atmos, and DTS: x.
The Ultra slim design makes the cable more flexible, so they can fit better in tight spaces with Ultra slim wall mounts and making cable management easier.
Supports all HDMI resolutions up to 8K@60Hz, including 4k@120hz, 3D video, and multi-view video.
body.description: Ultra Slim 8K Ultra High Speed HDMI Cables are the next generation of HDMI cables. Supporting resolutions up to 8K@60Hz, including 4K@120Hz, and 48Gbps bandwidth, this future proofed cable just might be the last HDMI cable you'll ever need. 48Gbps is the bandwidth required to support all features found in the HDMI 2. 1 specification. It supports Dynamic HDR to take full advantage of HDR's expanded contrast ranges, brightness levels, and heightened levels of detail, optimized on a scene-by-scene or even a frame-by-frame basis.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.8 4.8 out of 5 stars 313 ratings 4.8 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Ultra Slim 8K Ultra High Speed HDMI Cables are the next generation of HDMI cables. Supporting resolutions up to 8K@60Hz and 48Gbps bandwidth, this future proofed cable just might be the last HDMI cable you'll ever need. 48Gbps is the bandwidth required to support all features found in the HDMI 2.1 specification. It supports Dynamic HDR to take full advantage of HDR's expanded contrast ranges, brightness levels, and heightened levels of detail, optimized on a scene-by-scene or even a frame-by-frame basis. This cable complies with the HDMI 2.1 standard, which makes it compatible with the latest hardware, including the PlayStation 5, PlayStation 5 Digital Edition, Xbox Series X, and Xbox Series S.

Supports 8K@60Hz and 4K@120Hz The 8K@60Hz resolution delivers a more immersive viewing experience, with sharper high speed content, while the 4K@120Hz resolution produces ultra fast and sharp images, which are great for sports, high performance gaming, and VR. Dynamic HDR Dynamic HDR ensures that every moment of a video is displayed with its ideal depth, detail, brightness, contrast, and a wider color gamut, optimized on a scene-by-scene or even a frame-by-frame basis. 48Gbps Bandwidth These cables deliver 48Gbps bandwidth, which helps prevent handshake issues, snow, video noise, and other anomalies. They fully support high bandwidth dependent video and audio features, such as Dynamic HDR, Dolby Vision, Dolby Atmos, and DTS:X. Ultra Slim Design The ultra slim design makes the cable more flexible, so they can fit better in tight spaces with ultra slim wall mounts and making cable management easier.

Features Fully supports all features found in the HDMI 2.1 specification Supports all HDMI resolutions up to 8K@60Hz, including 4K@120Hz, 3D video, and multiview video Supports Dynamic HDR (High Dynamic Range) for brighter, deeper, and more lifelike colors Supports extended CEC (Consumer Electronics Control) commands and functions, the HDMI Ethernet Channel, and the eARC (Enhanced Audio Return Channel) features Supports AMD FreeSync on the PlayStation 4 Pro, Xbox Series X, and Xbox Series S consoles Supports SA-CD, DVD-Audio, DTS-HD Master Audio, Dolby TrueHD, and other high-definition audio standards Supports the 21:9 cinema aspect ratio Supports up to 32 audio channels and a 1536kHz audio sampling rate Supports Deep Color with up to 16-bits per channel, including the Sony x.v.Color standard Supports simultaneous delivery of dual video streams to multiple users on the same screen Supports Game Mode VRR, which produces a more fluid and better detailed gameplay experience

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Flexible & High Quality
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for a short, flexible HDMI cable to put in my sanus in wall media box for a Samsung frame set-up. This cable was perfect, works great, no HDMI handshake issues. While my TV is not 8K. It worked great with HDR 10+ with chroma set up for high bandwidth with my Apple TV.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent, thin HDMI cables
reviews.reviewText: While a little bit expensive for such a short length, these were exactly what I was looking for. They are very well constructed, and the cable itself is very flexible and thin.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars High Quality HDMI 2.1
reviews.reviewText: Bought this cable to connect my Apple TV 4K to my receiver and it works perfectly for that. Allows for 4K/120hz on other devices that I have tested it on as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Great cable, great price. Worked for eArc

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good and reliable
reviews.reviewText: Good bang for your buck and nice quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great! Skip their thick one, this one is thin, flexible and works better!
reviews.reviewText: Monoprice makes great stuff for the money, period. I ordered a couple of their regular thickness 18Gbps "certified" cables but it does not bend well and I actually had problems with mine. I could have exchanged it with Monoprice but since it was so thick and non-flexible I spent like 6 bucks for this one instead and am very happy! For this model Monoprice didn't pay the HDMI consortium racket for their "certification" but works perfect as at least HDMI 2.0b, can't say if it hits 48Gbps, but for most people it does.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Proof you don't need thick cables for HQ video and audio
reviews.reviewText: I have an apple TV 4th gen. It has an HDMI signal tester that kicks in when you select 4K Dolby Vision or 4K 60Hz output. These cables passed no problem. I like them because they don't put undue stress on the HDMI connectors on the processor and sources.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good option for most TV's
reviews.reviewText: If you're looking for a high quality 8K HDMI cable, the Monoprice Ultra 8K High Speed HDMI Cable is a great option. It supports 8K@60Hz, Dynamic HDR, and eARC, and it's slim enough to fit behind most TVs. The only downside is that it's only 1 foot long, so you may need to buy multiple cables if you have a large setup.
Cuidado, estos cables son basura, no funcionan, los probe en aparatos nuevos y viejos y no funcionan.
Produto "pega trouxa"! O anuncio diz que são 6 metros e o cabo tem, na realidade, 60 cm (2ft). Não compre senão, entrará para a lista de enganados...
As advertised it is an HDMI 2.1 cable, supports Xbox Series X at 4K/120fps

Compré este cable pensando que mejoraria la calidad de imagen de mi dispositivo, y creo que ocurrió lo contrario.Tengo un cable hdmi Sony viejo, y la calidad de imagen y sonido son bastante mejores en comparación con este cable, lo cual me dejó bastante decepcionado.
